title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to R. M. Manly, May 11, 1867
summary: Jackson's letter answers several questions related to the proposed use of the Methodist Episcopal Church in Staunton as a school building for free children. Jackson encourages the Bureau to contribute to the construction of the church so that it may be finished in time to use as a school.
keywords: Education, Aid/Relief, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
